metadata.title: CVE-2023-25516 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer, where an unprivileged user can cause an integer overflow, which may lead to information disclosure and denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25516` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

notes.note: mdeslaur> some binary drivers are no longer support by NVidia, so they are marked as ignored here

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-390: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-430: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-440: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-450: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-450-server package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '450.248.02-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-455: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
